page.title: 03Buildings near Scaleby Moss
page.content: Most of the cottages are of stone and slate,or even a clay and stone mixture.The oldest have thick walls and small windows and doors.Old stone barns often have stone steps to a door on the first floor. Some farmhouses are large.Some are the castles(peel towers)built in olden times to protect the household, live- stock and crops from raiders. Other farmhouses were built more recently than the stone cottages, when the area was becoming more prosperous. Most farms now have both old and new dwellings and farm buildings. They have been built up during centuries, often round a central yard. The old and the new are well-matched, and some past owners have included decorative roofs, chimneys and birdlofts in their developments to enhance the appearance.
